c74object.name: bach.dsort
c74object.description: Sorts a list depending to the distance of its element to a given fixed number (nearest elements coming first, farthest element at the end).

objarg.name: reference_number
objarg.description: The optional argument is the reference number. Distances are thus computed with respect to this number.

method.name: bang
method.description: Sorts the most recently received input llll with respect to the most recently received reference number.

method.name: float
method.description: Any number coming from the second inlet will be considered as the reference number for all distances.

method.name: float
method.description: A float in the second inlet sets or changes the interval (in milliseconds) between two consecutively output elements.

method.name: int
method.description: Any number coming from the second inlet will be considered as the reference number for all distances.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Sort llll and output result, set reference number
method.description:
If the llll comes through the left inlet, its are sorted by their distances with respec to the reference number defined in the second inlet (nearest elements coming first, farthest elements appearing at the end). The sorted llll is thus output from the left outlet, right after the list of indices of the sorted elements with respect to the original llll has been also output from the right outlet.
Any llll coming in the second inlet is considered to contain the reference number for all distances

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

c74object.discussion: bach.dsort is a small wrapper of bach.sort.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: bach.dsort is a small wrapper of bach.sort.
